chapter.title: Virtualization
chapter.para: Virtualization is the technology which allows to run multiple virtual computers (virtual machines, guests, VMs) on one real computer(host). ULFS have a virtualization support it can be used both on VMs and on Hosts.

ULFS provides specific virtualization software vision. Some virtualization platforms is not open-source (VmWare, Microsoft Hyper-V, Parrallels) some of open-source virtualization software have big issues (VirtualBox, Docker).
Virtualization software provided in ULFS is open-source and don't have big issues.

sect1.title: Linux containers
sect1.para: Linux containers (LXC) is technology of spliting physical computer environment to multiple virtual with same Linux kernel. LXC have best performance but provide limitations.

To install Linux containers (LXC) you can run
chimp install lxc
Warning: Linux kernel sources should be available and ready for modules compilation. Please check it before install.

sect1.title: QEMU
sect1.para: QEMU also known as KVM (Kernvel Virtual Machine) is powerful emulator which can run virtual machines on various platforms and operating systems: GNU/Linux, Microsoft Windows, KolibriOS, Haiku, ReactOS and others.
Warning: running Appple MacOS VMs is not supported. Running hacked versions of MacOS X (Hackintosh) is not recommended.

To install QEMU you can run
chimp install qemu
Warning: KVM support should be enabled in Linux Kernel.

sect1.title: Libvirt
sect1.para: Libvirt is virtualization API which simplify and controls virtualization proccess.

To install Libvirt you can run
chimp install libvirt

sect1.title: Virt-manager
sect1.para: Virt-manager is GUI-fronted for libvirt. Virt-manager is simplify virtualization process.

To install virt-manager you can run
chimp install virt-manager

sect1.title: SPICE
sect1.para: SPICE is complete open source solution for remote access to virtual machines in a seamless way so you can play videos, record audio, share usb devices and share folders without complications.

Spice server is integrated in QEMU. To install spice-client you can run
chimp install spice-gtk

sect1.title: FlexVDI SPICE
sect1.para: FlexVDI SPICE is improved version of SPICE. FlexVDI spice is allows VMs to use client's Internet connection via proxy-servers. Using client's Internet connection allow to eliminate risc of client abuse on Internet connection.

FlexVDI Spice server is not integrated in QEMU. To install it you shoud install qemu as usual then you have to run:
chimp install flexvdi-spice-protocol chimp install flexvdi-spice chimp install flexvdi-quemu

To install FlexVDI Spice client you can run
chimp install flexvdi-spice-gtk
